#Ggplot

```{r}
library(rnaturalearthdata)
library(rnaturalearth)

world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf")

mapdata <- ggplot(data = world) +
  geom_point(data = df_map, aes(x = Lon, y = Lat, color = Survey),
             show.legend = FALSE, size = 0.1) +
  geom_sf(color = 'grey90', fill = 'grey80') +  theme_classic() +
  coord_sf(xlim = c(-21, 31), ylim = c( 34.5 , 65),expand = FALSE) +
  geom_polygon(data = df_ecoregion3, fill = NA, size = 0.5, aes(x = long, y = lat,
                   group =  interaction(Ecoregion, piece)), color = 'black') +
  geom_label(data = df_ecoregion3_s, aes(x = lon_m, y = lat_m, label = Ecoregion)) +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())
```

```{r}
df_genre_et_sp <- sp_df_pc %>%
  dplyr::group_by(genre, sp) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(n = mean(sp))

df_genre_et_sp <- sp_df_pc %>%
  dplyr::filter(genre != sp) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(genre, sp) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(n = mean(predict))
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```
